Method Detail

downloadAndStage

public static boolean downloadAndStage(java.lang.String eclipseHome,
                                       java.lang.String eclipseApp,
                                       java.lang.String equinoxAppName,
                                       java.util.Set<java.lang.String> updateSiteURLCollection,
                                       java.lang.String destinationDirectory,
                                       boolean verbose,
                                       boolean raw,
                                       boolean eraseOld)
                                throws java.io.IOException
to download (mirror) a p2 repository / update site . Sets the stage for analysis later on. an eclipse installation with p2 is required to execute this.

Parameters:
eclipseHome - the path of eclipse home without the trailing slash(/) .
eclipseApp - the name (or the relative path from the eclipseHome path to) the eclipse executable application
equinoxAppName - the name of the equinox application. generally it is org.eclipse.equinox.p2.artifact.repository.mirrorApplication
updateSiteURLCollection - Set collection of the URLs of the sites from where the plugins and metadata would be fetched. This is generally a collection of eclipse p2 repositories / update sites. Each of the URLs in the collection must be without 'site.xml' at the end.
destinationDirectory - this is there the mirrored site would be available. It automatically gets created by eclipse's equinox p2 application if it does not exist already.
verbose -
raw -
eraseOld - true if you want the old destinationDirectory to be erased first. All its contents will be erased first and then the mirroring will be done.
Throws:
java.io.IOException

downloadAndStageWithEclipseInstallation

public static boolean downloadAndStageWithEclipseInstallation(java.lang.String eclipseHome,
                                                              java.lang.String eclipseApp,
                                                              java.lang.String equinoxAppName,
                                                              java.lang.String baseEclipseInstallationHome,
                                                              java.util.Set<java.lang.String> updateSiteURLCollection,
                                                              java.lang.String destinationDirectory,
                                                              boolean verbose,
                                                              boolean raw,
                                                              boolean eraseOld)
                                                       throws java.io.IOException
to download (mirror) eclipse repositories / update sites along with a base eclipse installation . Sets the stage for analysis later on. an eclipse installation with p2 is required to execute this.

Parameters:
eclipseHome - the path of eclipse home without the trailing slash(/) .
eclipseApp - the name (or the relative path from the eclipseHome path to) the eclipse executable application
equinoxAppName - the name of the equinox application. generally it is org.eclipse.equinox.p2.artifact.repository.mirrorApplication
baseEclipseInstallationHome - the path to the base eclipse installation home, without the trailing slash(/) , in case this must also be staged for analysis in addition to the other p2 repositories / updates sites. The assumption is that all features and plugins will be available in flat directories at baseEclipseInstallationHome/features and baseEclipseInstallationHome/plugins respectively.
updateSiteURLCollection - Set collection of the URLs of the sites from where the plugins and metadata would be fetched. This is generally a collection of eclipse p2 repositories / update sites. Each of the URLs in the collection must be without 'site.xml' at the end.
destinationDirectory - this is there the mirrored site would be available. It automatically gets created by eclipse's equinox p2 application if it does not exist already.
verbose -
raw -
eraseOld - true if you want the old destinationDirectory to be erased first. All its contents will be erased first and then the mirroring will be done.
Throws:
java.io.IOException
